30 30

Celebrating 30 Years of AIDS Vancouver

The 30 30 campaign was created in 2013 to celebrate AIDS Vancouver’s 30th anniversary. The campaign pieces together the dynamic history of HIV in Vancouver, told by and for those who where there.

1985

1986

Positive Living BC

In 1986

  • Expo 86 was held in Vancouver. Expo skytrain line is then opened by Prince Charles and Princess Diana. LINK
  • Space Shuttle Challenger disaster. LINK
  • The Oprah Winfrey Show premieres. LINK

Local

  • PDA Founder, Kevin Brown, was the first person in Canada to receive AZT treatment.
  • AIDS Vancouver establishes the first Safe Sex Forum. LINK
  • First Vancouver AIDS Walk organized by the PWA, now Positive Living BC. LINK
  • Established Vancouver Persons with AIDS Coalition, today called Positive Living BC. LINK
  • Meeting called 'Women and AIDS' is held. LINK

Statistics

  • 63 Reported AIDS Cases in BC. LINK
  • 24,559 deaths in US. LINK
  • 663 Canadians diagnosed. LINK

Global

  • Global Programme on AIDS created (later replaced by UNAIDS). LINK
  • HTLV-III renamed HIV. LINK
  • Uganda establishes the first sex education program. LINK
  • Jon Parker, first person to distribute injection equipment publicly in US. LINK
  • Global Network of People living with HIV /AIDS founded. LINK
  • US Justice dept rules that PWAs or perceived PWAs may be legally fired. LINK

National

  • Toronto becomes first city to develop an AIDS strategy in Canada. LINK
  • Canadian AIDS Society has first formal General Meeting. LINK
  • A HIV inmate at Millbrook is kept in isolation for a year, after guards’ union file that HIV is dangerous in the workplace. LINK
  • The first Fashion Cares Gala event is held in Toronto, hosted by and for ACT. LINK
1987

Print Sponsor
AIDS Vancouver - Prevent. Act. Support.

AIDS Vancouver plays a special role in providing quality health care to people affected by HIV/AIDS living in the Lower Mainland. It is clearly more than just a community health care organization. It is an organization whose presence and continued strength is essential to the quality for life of this community and of each individual and family who draws on its services. Our Agency is a vital community asset which everyone affected by HIV/AIDS can share, and in which we all have a stake.

Visit us at aidsvancouver.org

2013 © AIDS Vancouver
